intro: Tinguarra sicula, commonly known as the Sicilian tinguarra, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its fragrant, small white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Its leaves are usually simple and alternate, with a glossy surface, and it produces small, round fruits that are edible. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
